Articles.Content:
Done, made a lap of 1:31 (1:30 - 3:01)

Standing Start

Crossing the finish line

Path map
Frafor, a closeup of that turn near the VAB? (turn 10 it looks like) You may have cut it.

I'd also like to see Turn 5. Seems you may have gone over the corner with more than half your car on the grass.

Random note: I ran my lap passing most of next year's regulations. I'll do this until Race Three.

Next season's cars can be revealed between Race 7 and 9. Alternatively, they can be shown in the Season 2 thread when it is opened.

Edited February 15, 2014 by Kyrian

I just realised, that - rather embarrasingly - me and Kyrian are leading... in our own championship xD That can't be good for publicity.

Come on people, step it up ^^

Yeah, well I set the first time so everyone's tried to (and has) beat it. Also, are we allowed to submit a better time? My 2.00 is looking pretty bad now.
I'm thinking of having a maximum of 2 resubmissions next season. For now, go crazy. Just edit your old post and I'll check that.

In that case, I will make sure to improve my time ^ Though I don't know if i can actually beat Frafor since his car is lighter than mine. Unless....

<wild idea appears>

Be right back.

Turn 12 is okay

Turn 5 and Turn 11 are a bit cutted but I didn't care because you said taking grey brick walkways as part of the track is permitted.
New time on my old post

Nice improvement, CaptainGiblets! It's a shame you couldn't get in to the points.

I'll be doing a new lap, but this time with more RCS. I only had 15 units as per next season's regulations, I'm thinking of using 25-30 and seeing if that gives me any improvement.

Thanks, My car isn't as good as I thought it would be, good speed but doesn't have the acceleration to get it there. But I will learn from mistakes and be better next year. But I might do a 3rd submission and get a 1:45, I think I can get 5 seconds faster, if I study my line and KSP physics

Nice improvement, CaptainGiblets! It's a shame you couldn't get in to the points.

I'll be doing a new lap, but this time with more RCS. I only had 15 units as per next season's regulations, I'm thinking of using 25-30 and seeing if that gives me any improvement.

Edited February 16, 2014 by CaptainGiblets
Kyrian, could you update the OP with times and scores? That would make it much easier to see.
I'm updating this post with all the times. There's a link to it in the OP.
Grah. Couldn't beat my old best time. My racer's too heavy for this course. Ah well, better luck on track 2 I hope.

Well, if it's heavy your have more control, so on the short circuits you have a advantage

Grah. Couldn't beat my old best time. My racer's too heavy for this course. Ah well, better luck on track 2 I hope.

Well, if it's heavy your have more control, so on the short circuits you have a advantage

Or a great disadvantage because he has to lug all that weight around with him, killing the boost he can get from RCS and his acceleration in the first place.

But, on a circuit like Monaco in F1 the weight would transfer into grip giving him better cornering speeds if he could get up to those speeds

Or a great disadvantage because he has to lug all that weight around with him, killing the boost he can get from RCS and his acceleration in the first place.

Equally, it would make it more difficult for him to maneuver the car due to it's huge inertia, wasting a lot of time slowing down enough for corners - or regaining speed after a corner.

The small grip advantage you ay have with more weight (and thus more traction) is insignificant when compared to added drag and reduced overall performance. There is a reason lighter cars are quicker around circuits - particularly street circuits - than heavy cars.

Weight can be an issue to minimise. Next season, try I-Beams and 1x1 plates.

Edited February 16, 2014 by Kyrian

I don't even... what the hell is that thing xD

Well, you have 4 control surfaces, that's fine. Kyrian has to verify whether their placement is allowed but I see no problem - it's pretty mindblowing though xD

This is so awesome it scared a fart out of me

I can't see it. Imgur is blocked at school.

Found an illegality:

Vehicle is in violation of:

Aerodynamics:

1. Four (4) Small Control Surfaces permitted. 2 are to be at the front of the vehicle, and 2 are to be at the rear.

The vehicle has 1 surface at the front, 1 at the rear and 2 in the middle. Although this complies with the original statement of "Four (4) Small Control Surfaces permitted", it however does not comply with the law of placement.

Design must be changed, or there is a possibility of disqualification. I may allow the car to compete at my discretion. (PM me and we'll discuss.)

Sorry about that.

- Kyrian
